reason:
KIRILLOV MODEL DIMENSION MISMATCH: NODE SAYS F^x FOR ALL n BUT SHOULD BE F^{n-1}\{0} FOR n >= 2. The node states: "Let K(pi, psi) denote the Kirillov model of pi, realized as a space of locally constant functions on F^x." This is correct ONLY for n=1 (where the Kirillov model of a GL_1 representation acts on functions on F^0\{0} -- which is trivial -- or more accurately, for GL_2 the Kirillov model is on F^x). But the node is describing the case n >= 1 generally in the same paragraph.

For general GL_n with n >= 2, the Kirillov model K(pi, psi) is realized on the space of locally constant functions on F^{n-1}\{0} (functions on the last column of the mirabolic subgroup P_n, minus the origin). The node later (in the parenthetical about general n) mentions "Whittaker function whose Kirillov restriction has support contained in a compact subset of F^{n-1}\{0}" which is correct for general n, but the initial description "locally constant functions on F^x" is only correct for n=1 (or more precisely, for pi on GL_2 using the GL_2 Kirillov model).

This creates confusion: the Schwartz space S(F^x) is defined in the F^x context, and phi_0 = char(o^x) is defined as a function on F^x. For n >= 2, the correct objects are S(F^{n-1}\{0}) and phi_0 = char((o^x)^{n-1}), as the children 1.3.1 and 1.3.2 use. The parent node should clearly state the dimension of the Kirillov model domain depends on n, and specify: for n=1 (GL_2 representation), K(pi, psi) is on F^x; for general GL_n, K(pi, psi) is on F^{n-1}\{0}.
